hi,
 
I have the following queries.Pls answer them.
 
 A.Pls take a look at the following class :
 
class XYZ{
public Hashtable stvalues(){
//this method hits the database and retrives a set of values 
// lets says a persons name,address,salary and computes some values on the salary
}
}
assuming i have imported the required packages.
 
class TestXYZ extends TestCase{
 
public void teststvalues(){
//test code
}
}
 
The only way i can test the method is to create a Hashtable object with the expected data and compare it with actual data.
but the expected values for the hashtable depends(indirectly) upon the state of database (the values in the table person).
Also i need to build a hashtable object with all the values(which could run into say some 100 rows.if i am having 100 rows ,i need to check the all the 100 rows instead of a sample 2 rows of test data .) in my database which is tedious.and while building the object,the test may also become invalid because the database state may change in time and the fixture may become invalid.
 
Is there any way to address 
1.problem of the tedious way of building the values in the hashtable ?
2.also the invalidity of test data with time.
 
B.Also i am using Junit to test certain functions of session beans ?
am using a combination of the  InitialContext object ,javax.rmi.PortableRemoteObject.narrow method,create() method of my interface which extends EJBHome to create an instance of the object required and then testing the functions .
Am not sure whether this an valid approach.
Is there any other better approach ?
 
C. Can Junit be used to test getter methods which have some DB hits and some logic in it ?
    Is it in conformance with Junit philosophy ?
 
 
Thanks in advance for your replies.

Thanks and Regards 
Naveen.N
